description: Life and Health Insurance Underwriting Manual - Risk Assessment Guidelines

policies.name: Blood Pressure Risk Assessment
policies.description: Guidelines for evaluating blood pressure readings in life insurance applications

criteria.rationale: Normal blood pressure per AHA guidelines. No additional mortality risk.
Elevated blood pressure. Minimal additional risk if no other factors.

criteria.action: Standard rates if controlled on single medication; otherwise +25% loading
criteria.rationale: Stage 1 hypertension. Acceptable if well-controlled with good compliance.

criteria.action: +25-50% loading depending on control and duration
criteria.rationale: Stage 2 hypertension. Significant cardiovascular risk requiring premium adjustment.
Severe hypertension with elevated stroke and cardiac event risk.

criteria.action: Defer pending control, or decline if uncontrolled
criteria.rationale: Hypertensive crisis range. Unacceptable mortality risk without documented control.

modifying_factors.impact: Longer duration with good control is favorable; recent diagnosis needs monitoring
Poor compliance increases risk by +25%
Presence increases risk level by one category
Each comorbidity adds +15-25% to loading
3+ medications suggests resistant hypertension; increase loading by +25%

policies.name: Cholesterol and Lipid Panel Risk Assessment
policies.description: Guidelines for evaluating cholesterol and lipid levels

criteria.condition: Total Cholesterol < 200 AND LDL < 100 AND HDL >= 60
criteria.rationale: Optimal cholesterol levels with cardioprotective HDL.
Borderline levels acceptable without additional risk factors.

criteria.action: Standard rates if on statin therapy with good response
criteria.rationale: Borderline high LDL. Treatment response is key consideration.
High cholesterol with increased atherosclerotic risk.
Very high cholesterol. Screen for genetic causes and CAD risk.

criteria.action: +25% loading for low HDL as independent risk factor
criteria.rationale: Low HDL is independent cardiovascular risk factor.

modifying_factors.impact: Ratio > 5.0 adds +15% to loading
Pancreatitis risk; add +25% and require monitoring
LDL reduction > 50% on therapy is favorable
Add +15% if first-degree relative with CAD before age 55 (male) or 65 (female)

policies.name: Diabetes and Glucose Risk Assessment
policies.description: Guidelines for evaluating diabetes and glucose control

criteria.rationale: Normal glucose metabolism with no diabetes risk.

criteria.action: Standard rates with pre-diabetes notation; monitor progression
criteria.rationale: Pre-diabetes state. Higher conversion risk but currently acceptable.

criteria.condition: Type 2 Diabetes with HbA1c < 7.0% AND no complications
criteria.action: +50-75% loading depending on duration and treatment
criteria.rationale: Well-controlled T2DM. Loading based on duration and medication intensity.

criteria.action: +75-100% loading; require recent eye and kidney exams
criteria.rationale: Suboptimally controlled diabetes with increased complication risk.

criteria.condition: Type 2 Diabetes with HbA1c > 8.0% OR complications present
criteria.rationale: Poor control with established or high risk of microvascular complications.

criteria.action: Individual assessment; typically +100-200% based on control and complications
criteria.rationale: T1DM requires specialized assessment. Control history critical.

modifying_factors.impact: Each 5 years adds +10-15% to loading
Adds +25-50% depending on severity
Adds +50-100% depending on stage
Adds +25% for documented peripheral neuropathy
Not inherently negative if control is good; intensive regimen may be favorable

references: ADA Standards of Medical Care in Diabetes 2024
Reinsurance Group of America Diabetes Guidelines

policies.name: Body Mass Index Risk Assessment
policies.description: Guidelines for evaluating BMI and obesity-related risk

criteria.rationale: Normal BMI range with optimal mortality outcomes.

criteria.action: Standard rates for overweight without comorbidities
criteria.rationale: Overweight category. Minimal impact if metabolically healthy.

criteria.action: Standard to +25% based on metabolic health and build
criteria.rationale: Class I obesity. Assess for metabolic syndrome components.
Class II obesity with increased all-cause mortality risk.
Class III obesity. Significant impact on longevity.

criteria.action: Decline or highly rated with coverage limitations
criteria.rationale: Super obesity with severe mortality implications.
Underweight. Rule out eating disorders, malignancy, or chronic illness.

modifying_factors.impact: Athletic build with high muscle mass may mitigate BMI impact
Each component (HTN, dyslipidemia, glucose) adds +10-15%
Recent weight loss is favorable; recent gain requires explanation
Untreated adds +25%; treated with CPAP compliance is neutral

criteria.condition: Hypothyroidism - stable on replacement, TSH normal
criteria.rationale: Well-controlled hypothyroidism has minimal mortality impact.

criteria.action: Standard rates with medication adjustment note
criteria.rationale: Subclinical or undertreated hypothyroidism. Easily correctable.

criteria.action: Standard to +25% depending on treatment and duration
criteria.rationale: Controlled hyperthyroidism. Monitor for cardiac effects.

criteria.action: +25-50% loading; defer if thyroid storm risk
criteria.rationale: Active hyperthyroidism with cardiac and metabolic risks.

criteria.condition: Thyroid cancer - papillary, treated, no recurrence > 5 years
criteria.rationale: Papillary thyroid cancer has excellent prognosis post-treatment.

criteria.condition: Thyroid cancer - other types or recent treatment
criteria.action: Individual assessment based on type, stage, and treatment response
criteria.rationale: Non-papillary thyroid cancers require careful staging review.

modifying_factors.impact: If secondary to hyperthyroidism, adds +25% even if controlled
Indicates autoimmune activity; may add +10-15%
Poor compliance with thyroid medication increases risk

policies.name: Family History - Cardiovascular Disease
policies.description: Guidelines for evaluating family history of cardiovascular disease

criteria.condition: No family history of premature CVD
criteria.rationale: Absence of family CVD history is protective factor.

criteria.condition: One first-degree relative with CVD after age 60
criteria.rationale: Late-onset CVD in family has minimal impact on applicant risk.

criteria.condition: One first-degree relative with CVD before age 55 (male) or 65 (female)
criteria.action: Standard rates with notation; enhanced screening if other risk factors
criteria.rationale: Single premature CVD event suggests genetic predisposition.

criteria.condition: Two+ first-degree relatives with premature CVD
criteria.rationale: Strong family history indicates significant hereditary risk.

criteria.condition: Parent died of CVD before age 50
criteria.action: +25-50% loading depending on applicant's own risk factors
criteria.rationale: Very premature parental CVD death is significant risk marker.

modifying_factors.impact: Normal lipids, BP, and glucose can offset family history
Each additional affected relative adds +10%
Known genetic mutations may require specialized assessment

references: Framingham Heart Study Family Risk Data

policies.name: Family History - Cancer
policies.description: Guidelines for evaluating family history of cancer

criteria.condition: No family history of hereditary cancer syndromes
criteria.rationale: No family cancer history is neutral to favorable.

criteria.condition: One first-degree relative with cancer after age 60
criteria.rationale: Cancer in elderly relatives is common and not highly predictive.

criteria.condition: One first-degree relative with breast/ovarian/colon cancer before age 50
criteria.action: Standard rates; note hereditary cancer screening recommendation
criteria.rationale: Early-onset cancer suggests possible hereditary component.

criteria.condition: Two+ first-degree relatives with same cancer type
criteria.rationale: Clustering of same cancer type indicates hereditary syndrome.

criteria.condition: Known BRCA1/2 or Lynch syndrome carrier in family (applicant not tested)
criteria.rationale: 50% chance of carrying mutation. Testing may refine risk.

criteria.condition: Applicant is confirmed BRCA1/2 or Lynch syndrome carrier
criteria.action: Individual assessment; typically +100-150% or cancer exclusion
criteria.rationale: Confirmed genetic mutation with high lifetime cancer risk.

modifying_factors.impact: Mastectomy/oophorectomy significantly reduces risk for BRCA carriers
Adherence to screening may allow reduced loading
Suggests Li-Fraumeni or other rare syndromes; specialist review required

references: American Cancer Society Family History Guidelines
Gen Re Hereditary Cancer Underwriting Manual

policies.name: Tobacco Use Risk Assessment
policies.description: Guidelines for evaluating tobacco and nicotine use

criteria.rationale: Never smokers have optimal mortality profile.
Risk normalizes after 5+ years of cessation for moderate use history.

criteria.action: Non-smoker rates after 12-24 months; transitional rates during that period
criteria.rationale: Risk decreasing but still elevated in first few years post-cessation.
Active smoking significantly elevates cardiovascular and cancer risk.
Heavy smoking with dose-dependent mortality increase.

criteria.action: Non-smoker or transitional rates depending on cotinine testing
criteria.rationale: Occasional cigar/pipe use has lower but not negligible risk.

criteria.action: Smoker or tobacco user rates depending on product type
criteria.rationale: Oral cancer and cardiovascular risks present but lower than cigarettes.

criteria.action: Varies by carrier; typically transitional rates pending long-term data
criteria.rationale: Insufficient long-term mortality data. Treat as tobacco user by most carriers.

modifying_factors.impact: > 30 pack-years even if quit may warrant loading
Adds +25-50% to loading
Positive test confirms recent use regardless of stated history

references: Surgeon General's Report on Smoking and Health
Life Insurance Medical Directors Association Guidelines

policies.name: Alcohol Use Risk Assessment

criteria.rationale: Minimal to no alcohol use poses no additional risk.

criteria.condition: Moderate drinking (7-14 drinks/week for men, 7 for women)
criteria.rationale: Moderate alcohol use within guidelines. No significant impact.

criteria.condition: Heavy drinking (> 14 drinks/week men, > 7 women) without dependence
criteria.action: Standard to +25% based on duration and pattern
criteria.rationale: Heavy use increases liver and cardiovascular risks.

criteria.condition: History of alcohol use disorder, in recovery > 5 years
criteria.action: +25% loading; verify ongoing sobriety and treatment engagement
criteria.rationale: Long-term recovery with support shows reduced relapse risk.

criteria.condition: History of alcohol use disorder, in recovery 1-5 years
criteria.rationale: Early recovery period with elevated relapse risk.

criteria.condition: Current alcohol use disorder or active heavy drinking with health impact
criteria.action: Decline or defer pending treatment and documented recovery
criteria.rationale: Active alcoholism with severe mortality implications.

criteria.condition: Elevated liver enzymes (GGT, ALT) suggesting alcohol impact
criteria.action: +25-50% loading; require hepatology evaluation if severe
criteria.rationale: Biochemical evidence of liver impact from alcohol.

modifying_factors.impact: Single DUI > 5 years ago: minimal. Multiple or recent: +25-50%
Fatty liver: +25%. Cirrhosis: +100% or decline
Formal treatment completion is favorable

references: Swiss Re Alcohol and Drug Underwriting Manual
ASAM Criteria for Substance Use Disorders

policies.name: Occupational Risk Assessment
policies.description: Guidelines for evaluating occupation-related mortality risk

criteria.rationale: Sedentary professional work has baseline mortality risk.

criteria.condition: Skilled trades with moderate physical risk
criteria.action: Standard rates with occupational class adjustment
criteria.rationale: Electricians, plumbers, mechanics - moderate physical work.

criteria.condition: Construction, manufacturing with significant hazard exposure
criteria.action: Standard to +25% based on specific duties and safety record
criteria.rationale: Industrial settings with injury and exposure risks.

criteria.action: Occupational loading or exclusion for aviation accident
criteria.rationale: Transport occupations have specific accident risk profile.
High-risk extractive industries with elevated fatality rates.
First responder and military roles with duty-related mortality risk.

criteria.condition: Offshore oil/gas, deep sea diving, extreme heights work
criteria.rationale: Extreme environment occupations with significant accident risk.

modifying_factors.impact: Experienced workers have lower accident rates
Strong safety record may reduce loading
Supervisory roles typically lower risk than field positions

references: Bureau of Labor Statistics Occupational Fatality Data
